text: Psalm 57
Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
For the \add music\add* director, \add according to\add* Do Not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.
When he fled from Saul into the cave.\f + \fr Ps 57 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me,
because in you my soul takes refuge.
In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge
until destruction passes by.
I will call to God Most High,
to God who accomplishes \add things\add* concerning me.
He will send from heaven and save me;
he will reproach \add the\add* one who tramples me. \qs Selah\qs*
God will send his loyal love and his faithfulness.
My soul \add is\add* among lions.
I lie down \add among those who\add* devour—
the children\f + \fr 57:4 \ft Or “sons” \f* of humankind whose teeth \add are\add* spears and arrows
and whose tongues \add are\add* sharp swords.
Be exalted above the heavens, O God.
\add Let\add* your glory \add be\add* above all the earth.
They have set a net for my steps;
my soul is bowed down.
They have dug a pit before me;
they have fallen into the midst of it. \qs Selah\qs*
My heart \add is\add* steadfast, O God;
My heart \add is\add* steadfast.
I will sing and give praise.
Awake, my glory;
Awake, harp and lyre.
I will awake \add the\add* dawn.\f + \fr 57:8 \ft Or “\fq at \ft dawn” \f*
I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord;
I will give you praise among \add the\add* nations.
Because your loyal love \add is\add* high to \add the\add* heavens,
and your faithfulness to \add the\add* clouds.
Be exalted above \add the\add* heavens, O God.
\add Let\add* your glory \add be\add* above all the earth.
